result.execSummary:
The defendant Arquan T Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges as ordered in Count 2
Consecutive to: Counts 2 and 3 and any other sentences; Huber privileges for treatment at West Grove Clinic. Sentence is FORTHWITH

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Counts 1 and 3 and any other sentences

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, which only applies to count 2 and 3, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence.

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3:
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Mental Health Treatment.
- Attend and complete parenting classes. **sign release to give UA results probation agent.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Alexis B., until the completion of BIP counseling and sober. Parties may not reside together without court approval.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Counts 1 and 2 and any other sentences

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Arquan T Jackson in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1, COUNT #2 and AMENDED COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #2, and #3 and any other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
Huber privileges for treatment at West Grove Clinic.  Sentence is FORTHWITH. 

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #1 and #3 and any other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.   

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #1 and #2 and any other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.   

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-- applies to counts #2 and #3.  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Treatment. 
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
   -- sign release to give UA results to Probation Agent.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Alexis B. , 
   until the completion of of BIP counseling and sober.  
   Parties may not reside together without court approval.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   -- DV surcharge only applies to counts #2 and #3. 
 --- pay costs and fees for count #1.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Arquan T Jackson in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1 AMENDED the Charge to Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 946.41(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3 AMENDED the Charge to Battery (Domestic Abuse Assessments), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1) and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.   mld

Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-24-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Defense needs time to obtain complete set of discovery/video.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised that the previously ordered No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with A.B.

Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.   Student Intern Katie Seelow under the supervision of Michael Christopher Schindhelm for Nicolas Heitmant appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Branch 23 will not be in session on next date; case adjourned to Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alexis B.    AND/OR  her residence    AND/OR   her place of employment

No dangerous weapons
No firearms
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Arquan T Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-051

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing.
